page.title: 07LANGOLD
page.content: {Langold }used to be called {Langholt} which meant {Long wood.}Langholt was bought by the Royalist Sir Ralph Knight in {1662}and he also bought{ {Letwell.}His descendants still own land in Langold.Most of Langold consists of council houses. They are semi-detatched or terraced in rows of four. Langold is quite quiet. The A60 runs through the middle. There are two churches and seven food shops and seven other shops that don't sell food.There is a lake and a swimming pool in a country park.There are two pubs. There used to be a mine but it has been closed. That is why there are so many council houses.There used to be a{railway}as well to transport the coal.But today there is no industry in Langold so people have to go to other places to work. { }
